item.title: John Leonard
item.description: 'Critical' vulnerability in OpenSSH uncovered, affects almost all Linux systems14 million internet-facing servers are vulnerable, says Qualyshttps://www.computing.co.uk/news/4329906/critical-vulnerability-openssh-uncovered-affects-linux-systems#openssh #linux #sshd #qualys #vulnerability #infosec #cybersecurity

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
You can identify the middle (input) layer of the cortex by locating the crossover between gamma and alpha/beta power. It's common in the cortex and likely has significant functional relevance.Laminar Dynamics of Target Selection in the PPC
https://www.jneurosci.org/content/44/21/e1583232024.abstract#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
See also this work by @MendozaHalliday and @alexjamesmajor
Seen in 14+ cortical areas. Across 4 species
Mendoza-Halliday and Major et al
A ubiquitous spectrolaminar motif of local field potential power across the primate cortex
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41593-023-01554-7
#neuroscience

item.title: Popehat
item.description:
There are two elements to the immunity decision that are particularly extreme in a way that many will miss: (1) motive is irrelevant and (2) immune acts are not just excluded from prosecution, they‚Äôre excluded from evidence.
/1

item.title: Popehat
item.description: /8 At any rate, congratulations to the Federalist Society for an achievement beyond the reach of the British, outside the grasp of bloody civil war, impossible to Nazis and Soviets and terrorists: defeating the American idea.

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: Our corrupt Supreme Court didn't authorize an absolute, hereditary monarchy, so the "king" stuff isn't quite right. It did, however, clear the way for a dictatorship.

item.title: Popehat
item.description:
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an exaggeration at all to say the decision threatens the Republic. I might not have said so in 2015, before I saw how triumphantly lawless and autocratic the President could be, and how so many people would applaud it or at least shrug.

RE: https://bsky.app/profile/did:plc:oaghntcihvzqkirfcn4faarb/post/3kwawozaxtm2f

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description:
Quite a bit on display in this PubPeer thread :- ImageTwin has come of age
- Maybe every image duplication ever will now be found and posted...
- It seems that papermills have been operating peacefully for quite a while

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
Posted a book review that turned into more of an opinion piece on my blog - The Occasional Human Sacrifice by Carl Elliott.
Beautifully written and unusual in focusing on psychological impact on whistleblowers.
http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2024/07/whistleblowing-research-misconduct-and.html
